samples.context: Emily wanted to complete a marathon this year. She learned that if she trained consistently for the marathon, her endurance would increase. With greater endurance from training, Emily knew she could successfully complete the full marathon.
samples.question: If Emily trains for a marathon, can she complete it?

samples.context: Jenny wanted to launch a mobile app startup. She decided to enroll in an intensive coding bootcamp so she could learn new programming languages. Jenny knew that with these new coding skills, she would be able to build a mobile app herself.
samples.question: If Jenny takes a coding bootcamp, will she build a mobile app?

samples.context: Amy wanted to make her school's baseball team. She knew that if she practiced baseball regularly, she would improve her batting skills. And if she improved those skills, Amy knew she would likely make the team roster.
samples.question: If Amy practices baseball regularly, does she make the team roster?

samples.context: Mike just got a new puppy and wanted to train it. He learned that if he trained the puppy consistently, it would learn basic commands. Mike knew that if the puppy learned commands, it would start behaving properly.
samples.question: If Mike trains his new puppy, will it behave properly?

samples.context: Chris was struggling in his algebra class. He realized that if he put in time studying algebra every day, his understanding of the math concepts would improve. Chris also knew that with better understanding, he would be able to pass his upcoming exam.
samples.question: If Chris studies algebra, will he pass the exam?

samples.context: Dan wanted to start his own company. He realized that if he took the risk to start a company, he could grow the business over time. Dan knew that if his business grew, he would need to hire more people to meet demand.
samples.question: If Dan starts a company, does he hire more people?

samples.context: Bethany dreamed of becoming a published author. She learned that if she read and wrote every day, her writing skills would improve. With stronger writing abilities, Bethany could submit her work and get published.
samples.question: If Bethany reads and writes daily, can she get published?

samples.context: Jeff wanted to run a marathon. He learned that if he followed a rigorous training plan, he would get faster over time. Jeff also knew that if he got faster, he would be able to finish the marathon.
samples.question: If Jeff follows a training plan, will he finish the marathon?

samples.context: Lisa wanted her dog to win an upcoming competition. She knew that if she trained her dog consistently, it would learn challenging new tricks. Lisa realized that if her dog mastered the tricks, it could potentially win the competition.
samples.question: If Lisa trains her dog, does it win a competition?

samples.context: Emily wanted to find a new job this year. She realized that if she applied for many open positions, she would get more job interviews. With those interviews, Emily hoped she could land a great new job.
samples.question: If Emily applies for many jobs, does she find a new job?

samples.context: Emily dreamed of going to college but wasn't sure how to pay for it. She learned that if she applied for scholarships, she could get financial aid. Emily realized that if she got aid, she could afford to pay for college.
samples.question: If Emily applies for scholarships, can she afford college?

samples.context: Luis wanted to travel to France. He learned that if he studied French regularly, he would become fluent in the language. When he became fluent, Luis knew he could comfortably travel to France and communicate there.
samples.question: If Luis studies French, does he travel to France?

samples.context: Amy wanted to make her school's basketball team. She knew that if she practiced basketball daily, her skills would improve. Amy also knew that if her skills improved, she'd have a good chance of making the team.
samples.question: If Amy practices basketball daily, does she make the team?

samples.context: John decided to start learning guitar. He realized that if he took lessons, he would learn new skills. John knew that if he acquired these new skills, he would be able to play songs on the guitar.
samples.question: If John takes guitar lessons, can he play songs?

samples.context: Kevin wanted to win more chess games. He learned that if he studied chess strategies, he would become a better overall player. Kevin realized that if he became a better player, he would start winning more games.
samples.question: If Kevin studies chess strategies, does he win more games?
